uk.co.unitycoders.pircbotx.commandprocessor

Interface Message

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicMessage, ChannelMessage, UserMessage

    public interface Message
    Expose a common set of methods for all message types. This allows us to code modules which don't rely on being a channel message or being a private message, but simply treat both the same.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getBot

        org.pircbotx.PircBotX getBot()
        Get the bot this message was sent to.
        Returns:
        the instance of the bot which received the message

      • getUser

        org.pircbotx.User getUser()
        Get the user which sent this message.
        Returns:
        the user which sent the message

      • getRawMessage

        String getRawMessage()
        Get the message the bot received. This is mostly of use for the parsing function but may be useful to some commands. Previously, this was the only way to access message contents. Formatting will have been removed to make processing easier. The trigger character (if present) will have also been removed.
        Returns:
        the cleaned message

      • getMessage

        String getMessage()
        Get a representation of the message as it arrived to the command. This is identical to asking for all arguments using getArgument. Using getArgument is preferred as the parsing will have been done for you. You can use this if you have a special case though. The string will always be of the form "module action [args]". If the user provided no action the action then action will be set as default.
        Returns:
        a reconstructed normalised string

      • getArgument

        String getArgument(int id,
                   String defaultValue)
        Get a tokenised argument. The tokeniser will parse the message, extract quoted strings and then split by whitespace. Using this function you can extract arguments from a message. The zeroth argument is always the command name, the first is always the subcommand and 2 onwards is always the arguments. In the event the user calls a command with an invalid subcommand, default will be inserted as the subcommand.
        Parameters:
        id - the argument ID
        defaultValue - a value to return of the argument does not exist
        Returns:
        the argument at position id, else defaultValue

      • getTargetName

        String getTargetName()
        Gets the target of the message. If this is a channel message, this is the name of the channel. If this is a private message, this is the name of the user which sent the message.
        Returns:
        a channel name or user name

      • respond

        void respond(String message)
        Send a response to the user. This will send a response to the user highlighting them. If the message is a channel message, this will respond in the channel, if this message was a private message the bot will respond in a private message.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send

      • respondSuccess

        void respondSuccess()
        Respond that an operation was successful.

      • sendAction

        void sendAction(String action)
        Send an action to the user. This will use /me to send an action to the target. If the message is a channel message, this will respond in the channel, if this message was a private message the bot will respond in a private message.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to perform

      • insertArgument

        void insertArgument(int i,
                    String arg)
        Insert an argument into the message.
        Parameters:
        i - position of the new argument
        arg - the argument to insert
